name: Broken Dreams
description: A darkly-enticing story about unrequited love; Broken Dreams is a casual platforming game featuring full voice-acting, beautiful hand-drawn environments and a twist on the original platforming mechanic!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Pentium 2Ghz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 1Gb Storage: 16 MB available space Sound Card: Stereo Sound

reviews.review_text: I enjoyed it ... Simple as that :)

Pretty good game but needed some more instructions on how to play it. The level where 10 lights had to be in sync took way too long to figure out. But I got a solid hour of gameplay so can't complain.

Game's pretty boring and the story is crappy. Bad Voice Acting and Graphics but kinda commend the Music for being soothing. But that's the only thing that's worth of the game. THE SOUNDTRACK! Don't bother buying these even if it's on sale.
Why can I print from file? I thought I brought a game, not a school essay.  9/11 would print game again  (Would recommend if on sale otherwise don't bother buying it)

Well, this review will contain nothing about the gameplay, story, graphics and all that. I just wanted to write a review about the name, it's so true...it's like this game called 'irl' with the best graphics out there but the worst gameplay ever...most of that game ends up in the title of this game...

funny platformer game where you, just like st. Valentines, do everything to help boy and girl be together :) interesting levels, not trivial tasks, sometimes the boy refuses to jump - usually i don't play platformers but this one was so addictive i could make a break only at level 15 after numerous tries :)
